page.title: 16A School teacher's Day
page.content: I wake up each morning at about 6.50a.m. I lie in bed listening to radio 4 for about thirty minutes,before I get up to get the morning coffee.After a shower and breakfast I get in the car to drive the mile to school.My role at school is that of a Housemaster,as well as a History and European Studies teacher.In the House there are about 200 pupils,ranging in age from 13 to 18. These pupils are divided into 6 tutor groups.The majority of my time is taken up in dealing with pupil's problems and pastoral care. Although the school day ends at 3.40p.m.,I rarely leave school before 5.00p.m.When I get home I usually have an hour gardening,after which my wife and I have dinner.In the evening I spend about 2 or 3 hours doing school work,and get to bed about 11.30 or 12.
